title.div: The Plant Health (Wales) (Amendment) Order 2010 / Gorchymyn Iechyd Planhigion (Cymru) (Diwygio) 2010

div.p: This Order amends the Plant Health (Wales) Order 2006 (S.I. 2006/1643 (W.158)) (“the principal Order”) to implement Council Directive 2007/33/EC on the control of Potato Cyst Nematodes and repealing Directive 69/465/EEC (OJ No L 156, 16.6.2007, p.12). Directive 2007/33/EC introduces measures to detect and control European populations of Potato Cyst Nematode.

Mae'r Gorchymyn hwn yn diwygio Gorchymyn Iechyd Planhigion (Cymru) 2006 (O.S. 2006/1643 (Cy.158)) (“y prif Orchymyn”) er mwyn rhoi ar waith Gyfarwyddeb y Cyngor 2007/33/EC ar reoli Llyngyr Tatws a diddymu Cyfarwyddeb 69/465/EEC (OJ Rhif L 156, 16.6.2007, t.12). Mae Cyfarwyddeb 2007/33/EC yn cyflwyno mesurau i ganfod a rheoli poblogaethau Ewropeaidd o Lyngyr Tatws.

title.div: The Assembly Learning Grants (European University Institute) (Wales) (Amendment) Regulations 2010 / Rheoliadau Grantiau Dysgu'r Cynulliad (Athrofa Brifysgol Ewropeaidd) (Cymru) (Diwygio) 2010

div.p: These Regulations amend the Assembly Learning Grants (European University Institute) (Wales) Regulations 2009 (“the 2009 Regulations”).
Mae'r Rheoliadau hyn yn diwygio Rheoliadau Grantiau Dysgu'r Cynulliad (Athrofa Brifysgol Ewropeaidd) (Cymru) 2009 (“Rheoliadau 2009”).

entry.title: The Church of England Pensions (Amendment) Regulations 2010
The Ecclesiastical Judges, Legal Officers and Others (Fees) Order 2010
entry.summary: This Order increases the fees fixed by Table I of the Ecclesiastical Judges, Legal Officers and Others (Fees) Order 2009 (“the 2009 Order”) in relation to faculty proceedings (including proceedings in cases under the Care of Places of Worship Measure 1999), proceedings for an injunction or a restoration order under section 13(4) and (5) of the Care of Churches and Ecclesiastical Jurisdiction Measure 1991 (including appeals) and proceedings under section 4 of the Care of Cathedrals (Supplementary Provisions) Measure 1994 (including appeals), and the fees fixed by Table III of the 2009 Order for proceedings in respect of ecclesiastical offences under the Ecclesiastical Jurisdiction Measure 1963, including the provision for all cases where proceedings have been instituted under that Measure or where a person has been authorised to lay a complaint under the Measure, and appeals and the fees established by Table IV for proceedings under the Clergy Discipline Measure 2003.

entry.title: The Pool Betting Duty (Application of General Betting Duty Provisions) Regulations 2010
entry.summary: Regulation 2 of this instrument amends the General Betting Duty Regulations 2001 (S.I. 2001/3088) so that the existing provisions for general betting duty about furnishing returns, paying the duty, and changing between monthly and quarterly accounting periods are modified to apply to pool betting duty as well. Regulation 3 consequently repeals current provisions about the payment of pool betting duty.

entry.title: The Legal Officers (Annual Fees) Order 2010
entry.summary: This Order applies an increase of 1.725% (a weighted inflationary formula of 25% RPI and 75% AEI (2.4% and 1.5% respectively in 2009)) to the total of the annual fees for diocesan registrars fixed by the Legal Officers (Annual Fees) Order 2009. The increased total is then apportioned as to each registrar’s individual fee according to a formula based on the number of parishes and stipendiary clergy in each diocese.

title.div: The Poultry Compartments (Fees) (Wales) Order 2010 / Gorchymyn Compartmentau Dofednod (Ffioedd) (Cymru) 2010

div.p: This Order provides for the payment of fees for inspections in relation to applications for recognition as a compartment under the Poultry Compartments (Wales) Order 2010. That Order implements Commission Regulation (EC) No. 616/2009 which makes provision for the recognition of poultry compartments which meet high standards of biosecurity (OJ No L 181, 14.7.2009, p. 16).

Mae'r Gorchymyn hwn yn darparu ar gyfer talu ffioedd am arolygiadau o ran ceisiadau ar gyfer cydnabyddiaeth yn gompartment o dan Orchymyn Compartmentau Dofednod (Cymru) 2010. Mae'r Gorchymyn hwnnw yn gweithredu Rheoliad y Comisiwn (EC) Rhif 616/2009 sy'n gwneud darpariaeth ar gyfer cydnabod compartmentau dofednod sy'n bodloni safonau uchel mewn bioddiogelwch (OJ Rhif L 181, 14.7.2009, t. 16).

title.div: The Poultry Compartments (Wales) Order 2010 / Gorchymyn Compartmentau Dofednod (Cymru) 2010

div.p: This Order implements Commission Regulation (EC) No. 616/2009 which makes provision for the recognition of poultry compartments which meet high standards of biosecurity (OJ No L 181, 14.7.2009, p 16). Since application for recognition is voluntary the only sanction for failure to comply with the requirements of this Order is withdrawal of an approval of premises as a compartment.

Mae'r Gorchymyn hwn yn gweithredu Rheoliad y Comisiwn (EC) Rhif 616/2009 sy'n gwneud darpariaeth ar gyfer cydnabod compartmentau dofednod sy'n bodloni safonau uchel mewn bioddiogelwch (OJ Rhif L 181, 14.7.2009, t. 16). Gan fod y cais am gydnabyddiaeth yn wirfoddol, yr unig gosb am fethiant i gydymffurfio â gofynion y Gorchymyn hwn yw tynnu'n ôl gymeradwyaeth o fangre fel compartment.

entry.title: The Conduct of Employment Agencies and Employment Businesses (Amendment) Regulations 2010

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Conduct of Employment Agencies and Employment Businesses (Amendment) Regulations 2010

entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Conduct of Employment Agencies and Employment Businesses Regulations 2003 (S.I. 2003/3319) (“the 2003 Regulations”) and come into force on 1st October 2010. These Regulations make further provision for the proper conduct of employment agencies (“agencies”) and employment businesses; they increase the protection for work-seekers, reduce certain regulatory burdens on agencies and also make minor amendments to the 2003 Regulations.

entry.title: The Merchant Shipping (Ship-to-Ship Transfers) (Amendment) Regulations 2010
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the commencement provisions of the Merchant Shipping (Ship-to-Ship Transfers) Regulations 2010 to delay the commencement of those Regulations by six months.

entry.title: The Industrial Training (Construction Board) (Amendment) Order (Northern Ireland) 2010
entry.summary: This Order amends Schedule 1 of the Industrial Training (Construction Board) Order (Northern Ireland) 1964. It removes the provision or continued provision of water, gas, lighting, heating or ventilation activities from the scope of the Construction Industry Training Board in Northern Ireland. From 1 September 2010 employers engaged wholly or mainly in these activities will no longer be liable to pay levy to the Construction Industry Training Board, nor will they be able to benefit from Construction Industry Training Board grant or other support services.

entry.title: The Plant Health (Amendment No. 2) Order (Northern Ireland) 2010
entry.summary: This Order amends the Plant Health Order (Northern Ireland) 2006 by removing certain townlands previously scheduled as safety zones to protect against spread of potato wart disease (PWD). Previously the varieties of potatoes grown in these townlands were restricted, by the Plant Health Order (Northern Ireland) 2006, to PWD resistant types. The Order lifts restrictions on the growing of potatoes in the former safety zones as provided in Article 2.

entry.title: The Designation of Schools Having a Religious Character (Independent Schools) (England) (No. 2) Order 2010
entry.summary: This Order designates the independent schools named in the Schedule as having a religious character.

entry.title: The Nutrition and Health Claims (England) (Amendment) Regulations 2010
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the definition of “the Regulation”, meaning Regulation (EC) No. 1924/2006 of the European Parliament and of the Council on nutrition and health claims made on foods (OJ No. L12, 18.1.2007, p.3), contained in regulation 2 of the Nutrition and Health Claims (England) Regulations 2007 (S.I.2007/2080). The effect of the amendment is that a reference to the Regulation in S.I. 2007/2080 now includes any future amendments to its Annex, which consists of the list of authorised nutrition claims and conditions relating to their use (regulation3).

entry.title: The Further Education (Student Support) (Eligibility) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2010
entry.summary: These Regulations provide for financial support towards tuition fees to institutions of further education for students who are domiciled in a part of the United Kingdom other than Northern Ireland, in the European Community, or the European Economic Area, but are studying at Colleges of Further Education in Northern Ireland, in respect of the academic year beginning on or after 1st September 2010 and ending on 31st August 2011.

title.div: The Coleg Llysfasi College Further Education Corporation (Dissolution) Order 2010 / Gorchymyn Corfforaeth Addysg Bellach Coleg Llysfasi College (Diddymu) 2010

div.p: This Order dissolves the further education corporation established to conduct the educational institution called Coleg Llysfasi College with effect from 1 August 2010. It provides for the transfer of its property, rights and liabilities to Deeside College Further Education Corporation (Corfforaeth Addysg Bellach Coleg Glannau Dyfrdwy) and secures the rights of its employees by applying, with modification, section 26(2) to (4) of the Further and Higher Education Act 1992 (c. 13).

Mae'r Gorchymyn hwn yn diddymu'r gorfforaeth addysg bellach a sefydlwyd i gynnal y sefydliad addysgol o'r enw Coleg Llysfasi College ac yn cael effaith o 1 Awst 2010. Mae'n darparu ar gyfer trosglwyddo'i eiddo, ei hawliau a'i rwymedigaethau i Gorfforaeth Addysg Bellach Glannau Dyfrdwy (Deeside College Further Education Corporation) ac yn sicrhau hawliau ei chyflogeion drwy gymhwyso, gydag addasiadau, adran 26(2) i (4) o Ddeddf Addysg Bellach ac Uwch 1992 (p. 13).

entry.title: The Firearms (Amendment) Regulations 2010
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Firearms Act 1968, the Firearms (Amendment) Act 1988, the Firearms Rules 1998 and the Firearms (Northern Ireland) Order 2004 (“the Firearms legislation”) for the purpose of implementing the requirements of Directive 2008/51/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council (O.J. No. L179, 8.7.2008, page 5) (“the 2008 Directive”), which amends Council Directive No. 91/477/EEC on the control of the acquisition and possession of weapons (O.J. No. L256, 13.9.1991, page 51) (“the 1991 Directive”).

entry.title: The National Health Service (Reimbursement of the Cost of EEA Treatment) (Scotland) Regulations 2010

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The National Health Service (Reimbursement of the Cost of EEA Treatment) (Scotland) Regulations 2010

entry.summary: These Regulations give effect to the judgement of the European Court of Justice in CaseC‑372/04 The Queen, on the application of YvonneWattsv Bedford Primary Care Trust and Secretary of State for Health which held that the obligation under article49 of the EC Treaty (now article56 of the Treaty on the Functioning of the European Union which provides for the freedom to provide and receive services in another member state of the European Union) to reimburse the cost of hospital treatment provided in another member state also applies to a tax funded national health service, such as in Scotland, which provides treatment free of charge. These Regulations also cover non-hospital treatment.

entry.title: The Equality Act 2010 (Commencement No. 1) Order 2010
entry.summary: This order brings into force certain provisions of the Equality Act 2010 (c.15) listed in the Schedule, for the purpose of making subordinate legislation or guidance. It also commences provisions which amend the Equality Act 2006 (c.3), allowing the Commission for Equality and Human Rights (Equality and Human Rights Commission) to issue Codes of Practice in connection with any matter addressed in the Equality Act 2010. Notwithstanding these amendments, the existing code made under section 14 of the Equality Act 2006 (Disability Discrimination Act 1995 Code of Practice for Trade Organisations, Qualifications Bodies and General Qualifications Bodies (ISBN 978-1-84206-049-0)) will remain in place.

entry.title: The Offshore Installations (Safety Zones) (No.2) Order 2010
entry.summary: This Order establishes, under section 22 of the Petroleum Act 1987, a safety zone having a radius of 500 metres from the specified point, around each installation specified in the Schedule to this Order and stationed in waters to which section 21(7) of that Act applies (these include territorial waters and waters in areas designated under section 1(7) of the Continental Shelf Act 1964 (c.29)).
